sect1.title: Creating New Layers
sect1.para: There are several ways to create new layers in an image. Here are the most important ones:

listitem.para:
Selecting
Layer New Layer
in the image menu. This brings up a dialog that allows you to set the basic properties of the new layer; see the New Layer dialog section for help with it.

Selecting
Layer Duplicate Layer
in the image menu. This creates a new layer, that is a perfect copy of the currently active layer, just above the active layer.

When you cut or copy something, and then paste it using CtrlV or
Edit Paste , the result is a floating selection, which is a sort of temporary layer. Before you can do anything else, you either have to anchor the floating selection to an existing layer, or convert it into a normal layer. If you do the latter, the new layer will be sized just large enough to contain the pasted material.
